settings.title: What is Taare's return policy?
settings.answer:
Try your Taare gear risk-free for 30 days.

Here's what you need to know:

  • You can return within 30 days of the delivery.
  • Returns are free for Taare members

settings.title: Can I cancel my order?
settings.answer:
We completely get it, we change our minds too! While we wish could, once an order is placed, we are unable to alter or cancel it at this time. We hope to have a cancellation window one day in the future.

Should the item(s) not work out, make sure to exchange for a preferred style or return for a refund. As a reminder, domestic return shipping is free.

settings.title: Do you ship overseas?
settings.answer: Yes, we ship all over the world. Shipping costs will apply, and will be added at checkout.

settings.title: What is the shipping policy?
settings.answer: Once your order is placed, you will receive a confirmation email letting you know that our fulfillment team has received your order. Once your order is fulfilled, you will receive an email notification with your tracking information. Shipping fees are non-refundable in the case of returns.

settings.title: How should I clean the shoes?
settings.answer:
To keep your kids' shoes looking their best, follow these simple steps:

Precaution: Before cleaning, test a small amount of mild, dye-free detergent (suitable for dishwashing or laundry) on an inconspicuous area to ensure it won't damage the material.

Cleaning Steps:

  1. Use a soft-bristled brush (like a toothbrush) and mild detergent to gently scrub away dirt.
  2. Wipe clean with a damp cloth.
  3. Allow shoes to air dry for 24 hours before wearing.

Special Care:

  • For suede or leather shoes, use a specialized leather or suede cleaner.
  • Avoid machine washing or drying, as many materials can't withstand water submersion or heat.

By following these steps, you'll keep your shoes clean, fresh, and ready for their next adventure!

settings.title: When should I replace the shoes?
settings.answer:
Here are some guidelines to determine when a kid's shoe should be replaced:

General Guidelines:

  1. Every 3-4 months: Average lifespan of kids' shoes due to rapid growth and wear.
  2. When outgrown: Replace shoes when toes reach the end of the shoe or the heel no longer fits snugly.

Visual Inspection:

  1. Sole wear: Replace if sole is worn down to 1/8 inch or less.
  2. Heel wear: Replace if heel is unevenly worn or cracked.
  3. Upper material: Replace if torn, stained, or showing significant signs of wear.
  4. Insole wear: Replace if insole is flat or no longer provides support.

Other Signs:

  1. Discomfort: If child complains of foot pain or discomfort.
  2. Odor: Persistent odor despite cleaning.
  3. Performance: If shoes no longer provide adequate support or stability.

Additional Tips:

  1. Check shoes regularly, as growth rates vary.
  2. Consider replacing shoes more frequently for high-activity kids.
  3. Ensure proper fit to prevent blisters, discomfort, and potential long-term issues.

Remember, every child's needs are different. Consult a shoe fitter or pediatrician for personalized advice.

settings.title: How can I make the shoes last longer?
settings.answer:
To ensure optimal performance and longevity, consider the following tips:

Break Them In Soon

Get your kids to wear your new shoes within a reasonable time after purchasing. Leaving shoes unworn for extended periods can lead to:

  • Drying out of glue and cushioning materials
  • Reduced performance
  • Shortened lifespan

Rotate Shoes for Longer Life

Alternate between two or more pairs of shoes for your kids. This allows each pair to:

  • Air out and dry completely
  • Rebound and recover between wears, extending cushioning life
  • Last longer, with reduced wear and tear

By following these simple tips, your kids will get the most out of the shoes and enjoy better performance, comfort, and durability.

settings.title: Which organizations do you collaborate with?
settings.answer:
We're proud to be working with the following organizations that align with our ambitions to ensure a better world for our kids:

Soles4Souls: They turn shoes and clothing into educational and economic opportunities. Their programs, 4Opportunity, 4Relief, 4EveryKid and 4ThePlanet, aim to make a positive difference on the planet and in people's economic, educational, physical, and psychosocial well-being. Since 2006, more than 103 million pairs of shoes and pieces of clothing have helped create opportunities for people across 138 countries. Soles4Souls is headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, with Regional Donation Centers and warehouse locations around the world. Visit soles4souls.org for more information.
